item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "Sometimes I have loved the peacefulness of an ordinary Sunday. It is like standing in a newly planted garden after a warm rain. You can feel the silent and invisible life." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by hugh laurie
item.description: "Humility was a cult in my family. I only got it out of my father by accident when he was very old that he had won an Olympic gold medal." -- hugh laurie

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "I talk about going to [George W. Bush's] Inauguration and crying when he took the oath, 'cause I was so afraid he was going to wreck the economy and muck up the drinking water'... the failure of my pessimistic imagination at that moment boggles my mind now." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Rachel add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "If by a "Liberal" they mean someone who looks ahead and not behind, someone who welcomes new ideas without rigid reactions, someone who cares about the welfare of the people-their health, their housing, their schools, their jobs, their civil rights and their civil liberties-someone who believes we can break through the stalemate and suspicions that grip us in our policies abroad, if that is what they mean by a "Liberal", then I'm proud to say I'm a "Liberal." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Stephenie Meyer: Her vampires are sparkly, which I think we can all agree is wrong." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Rachel add a quote by George Clooney
item.description: "I don't believe in happy endings, but I do believe in happy travels, because ultimately, you die at a very young age, or you live long enough to watch your friends die. It's a mean thing, life." -- George Clooney

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don’t make money your goal. Instead pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can’t take their eyes off of you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There's a world of difference between truth and facts. Facts can obscure truth." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "I don't trust anyone who doesn't laugh." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Most people don't grow up. Most people age. They find parking spaces, honor their credit cards, get married, have children, and call that maturity. What that is, is aging." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "And no one will listen to us until we listen to ourselves." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Women are still in emotional bondage as long as we need to worry that we might have to make a choice between being heard and being loved." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Andrew Davidson
item.description: "I spent my entire life waiting for you, Marianne, and I didn't even know it until you arrived. Being burned was the best thing that ever happened to me because it brought you. I wanted to die but you filled me with so much love that it overflowed and I couldn't help but love you back. It happened before I even knew it and now I can't imagine not loving you. You have said that it takes so much for me to believe anything, but I <i>do</i> believe. I believe in your love for me. I believe in my love for you. I believe that every remaining beat of my heart belongs to you, and I believe that when I finally leave this world, my last breath will carry your name. I believe that my final word--<i>Marianne</i>--will be all I need to know that my life was good and full and worthy, and I believe that our love will last forever." -- Andrew Davidson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "No tears in the writer, no tears in the reader. No surprise in the writer, no surprise in the reader." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The scariest moment is always just before you start." -- Stephen King

item.title: Rachel add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "Read, read, read. Read everything -- trash, classics, good and bad, and see how they do it. Just like a carpenter who works as an apprentice and studies the master. Read! You'll absorb it. Then write. If it's good, you'll find out. If it's not, throw it out of the window." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "Most of the basic material a writer works with is acquired before the age of fifteen." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Einstein
item.description: "Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy." -- Einstein

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Golda Meir
item.description: "Don't be so humble - you are not that great." -- Golda Meir

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Cultivate your curves - they may be dangerous but they won't be avoided." -- Mae West

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand." -- Mae West
